intro: Sisymbrium canescens var. californicum, commonly known as the California whitethorn, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is characterized by its pale green to grayish foliage and small white or yellow flowers. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This variety is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal and inland areas of California.
